title.narrative: The Gambia Social Safety Net Project

description.narrative: The development objective of Social Safety Net Project for The, Gambia is to improve the coordination of social assistance activities and increase inclusion of the extreme poor in the Nafa program. This project has three components. 1) The first component, Development of Co-ordination Mechanisms for the Social Assistance Sector, aims to provide mechanisms to help coordination of social assistance activities. It has the following subcomponents: (i) Support for the establishment of a Social Protection Secretariat; and (ii) Support for the establishment of a Social Registry. 2) The second component, Nafa Program of Cash Transfers to the Eligible Extreme Poor and Social and Behavioral Change Communication, aims to finance: (a) the unconditional cash grants to beneficiaries; (b) the fees for the payment service provider; (c) the costs of community validation exercises, registration events, training of trainers and direct operational costs of the delivery of Social and Behavioral Change Communication (SBCC); (d) the development of new SBCC modules; (e) training costs to cascade the SBCC modules; (f) costs of printing beneficiary cards and SBCC materials; and (g) vehicles; and (h) an Impact Evaluation. 3) The third component, Project Management and Capacity Building, aims to finance the costs associated with the management of the project and capacity building activities.

condition.narrative: 1. The Recipient shall, no later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, recruit an accountant assistant and a procurementofficer, with qualifications and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

2. The Recipient shall, no later than three (3) month after the Effective Date: (a) recruit an internal auditor, withqualifications and under terms of reference acceptable to the Association; and (b) customize the existing accounting software toinclude the book keeping for the Project.
3. The Recipient shall, no later than six (6) month after the Effective Date, recruit an external auditor, with qualifications andunder terms of reference acceptable to the Association.

title.narrative: Cumulative amount transferred directly to beneficiaries
Number of beneficiary households attending the behavioural change sessions
Number of beneficiary households that start or increase savings activities
Number of households entered in the Social Registry
Number of households that start or increase entrepreneurship activity
Number of people trainedon SBCC (training of trainers)
Percentage of beneficiaries with increased knowledge of measures to improve human capital
Percentage of beneficiary households receiving the right amount of cash on time
Percentage of beneficiary households selecting a female household member as cash transfer recipient
Percentage of beneficiary households that have either adequate or good food consumptions scores
Percentage of grievances classified as resolved in grievance redress mechanism
Percentage of grievances that are classified and channeled through agreed resolution channels

Cash transfer program for the extreme poor established
National Monitoring and Evaluation framework established
Social and Behavioral Change program accompanying the cash transfer established
